Reviews.Author: Miutim

Reviews.Content: nice hotel, great location Before I went there, I've already read some review from this website, so I won't have any surprises. However, I still shocked when I saw the room. It's really small, especially the bathroom. But I think that is the only problem, cause the staff are great, location is superb, and I didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so eventually the small room was not a problem anymore. From the airport, I took Airport express, and then take a cab for just about HK$30. You can also take Airport bus no A21, the bus stop is only 10m away from the hotel. For breakfast, there is a lot of small restaurant near the hotel, with great food and not expensive. Overall, really loved staying here. I'll recommend this hotel for single/couple, but not for family, and honeymooners.
Reviews.Author: Tesa_Bdg

Reviews.Content: Always have a lovely time there Stayed there twice and both was as a single occupant. Although the rooms are small, but it has everything a tourist needs and the hotel staff is very willing to accomdate any requests. Kudos to the hotel!
Reviews.Author: Dayna_gal

Reviews.Content: Very Good hotel, with everything perfect...(for me, at least) Stayed 4 nights at Largos during my holidays in Hong Kong just last week (Aug 2008). My friend and I had a fantastic stay. We were greeted with polite reception, who tried their best to meet our room preferences. Upon arrival, my friend's luggage's passcode lock was faulty and refused to open. Desperate, we went down to the front desk to borrow a plier or screwdriver we could break the lock with. Instead, they offered to send a handyman to help us open the bag. He opened the lock within minutes. Throughout our stay, the hotel personnel attended to all our problems immediately, may it be setting our TV channels, or recommending the best places to eat. When we left, they even hailed a cab for us. As for room condition, it was clean and brightly lit, which gave us a comfortable feeling. The room was smaller than we expected, but sufficient for us. Location was very very strategic, right in front of Nathan Road. We could walk to Tsim Sha Tsui and Yau Ma Tei from the hotel. The MRT is barely a stone's throw away. There is also a very good Chinese cafe around the corner, with very good bubble tea. We grabbed a cup on the way back to the hotel every night.Overall, we're very very happy with the hotel.
Reviews.Author: HolidayPooh

Reviews.Content: Good value for Hong Kong My husband and I stayed here in April for 2 nights on the way to Europe and in June for 2 nights on the way home. Booking it through Agoda on the Net, we paid $A126 per night in April and around $A92 in June per night. Judging by other hotel prices in Hong Kong, although as others have commented that the rooms are small, we have stayed in smaller in Europe. The staff were courteous, helpful and the hotel was clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was only $HK55 (almost $A8) each and the transfer from the airport to hotel was reasonable although it was cheaper from hotel to airport with the same company, strangely enough. If you want to stay in an area typically Chinese more like the old China, then this area of Jordan is that. The MTR is just around the corner although make sure you ask the hotel for a map with directions on as we got lost taking the wrong exit at first. If you want some good quality and reasonably priced shops, rather than the touristy areas, catch the MTR two stops to Mong Kok where the locals shop. We found a multi-level shopping plaza where we did most of our shopping, called Langham Plaza with great specialist shops as well and great coffee shops.
Reviews.Author: Trav11

Reviews.Content: Little problem at Largos       Pool area but not of Largos Hotel : )
Reviews.Author: nic2k6y

Reviews.Content: Just Right Hotel! My wife, daughter and I stayed in Largos Hotel for 4 Days and 3 Nights and the hotel is fine for us. Though the room is small but its Hongkong so it's very understandable but it's clean and the bathroom is spotless. We avail the buffet breakfast inside the hotel once but we don't like the service at Largos Cafe because of there waiter. But overall the hotel is fine and in perfect location, Near Jordan Station and Nathan Road. But don't avail their buffet breakfast and besides the food is very basic, nothing special.
Reviews.Author: mackybree

Reviews.Content: Good location but bad service I chose this hotel is because strategic  convenient hotel to stay in HK  spend my holiday well. Unfortunately I spoil my holidays because those lady staffs especially lady supervisor from reservation department. I was staying in this hotel for 7days, the room is extremely small, I never ever see such a small hotel room. The carpet very dirty with dust and the cabinet/furniture are old. The front desk staffs were rude  unfriendly. I regret to stay in this hotel and they spoiled my holidays in Hong Kong.
Reviews.Author: JaniceDon

Reviews.Content: Convenient, specially if you are a solo traveler I was aware that I was not going to a great hotel. Having said that, I will go back again because of the location and the price.My room was very small but good for me since I was on my own. Carpets should be clean. If I had been travelling with my lady, I believe that she wouldn't have liked that all.Anyway just off Nathan Road and walking distance to the port, night market, and other atraction make this hotel a good choice.
Reviews.Author: Edmund0Dantes

Reviews.Content: Perfectly fine Rooms are small, just enough space to walk around. Perfectly fine for 2 persons. Toilets are small as well, but once again, just enough for you to do everything you need in a toilet. Room and toilet is really clean and cosy. Pefectly fine when you are on budget and want a location near to MTR. a 7 eleven like store 2 mins away as well together with a bread store where you can get breakfast. Breakfast is not provided, but in Hongkong i dont think most budget hotel provide breakfast. Lift is pretty small as well, but enough for luggages and 3-4 people. Extremely close to Jordon MTR station. 2 minutes is the duration. Great place to stay when on budget.
Reviews.Author: peacex

Reviews.Content: nice short stay we stay for 3 nights at this hotel. booked a double room, indeed it was small but clean. the room was still cold even i has switched off the air-con. I must recommend this to all, location was great and convenient. MTR was just right the corner, and with direct bus to and fro the airport at the bus stop opposite the street. near distance between timshashui, ladies street etc.Hotel room price is cheap as compared with other hotels along nathan road and should book via online hotels booking website.I will book again with this hotel in future.
Reviews.Author: wose

Reviews.Content: Short Stays Only Other than the excellent location near to Jordan MTR Station and Nathan Road, there is little to recommend about this hotel. The rooms, while fairly clean, are very small indeed and in need of renovation. The carpet was threadbare in places, paintwork in the bathroom was flaking and the decor was very old fashioned. The net curtains were filthy. There is no safe in the hotel room and valuables must be left at reception.There is no room service whatsoever. You can get breakfast from the Mayfair Cafe on the first floor, but it is of poor quality and is vastly overpriced (HK$55 including service charge).There is no Internet connection available in the room and the television on offer is extremely poor. Not so bad if you're only using this as a place to sleep on a quick stopover. Becomes a major problem if you're staying for longer than a couple of nights (On a work trip, for example). Mini-bar is understocked containing only beer (HK $36 for a small can), water and soft drinks. Though there is a 7/11 a few doors down the road, so can't really complain about this too much.The muzak piped into the lifts was enough to provoke a killing frenzy.On the plus side, the staff are friendly and polite. And the location really is good.Overall, you can do much better for the money. Only consider this hotel if you are staying for a very short period of time, the location really appeals or if you can't get a room at The Eaton (A far superior hotel in a very similar location).
Reviews.Author: Gurnox

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel       a view from our window
Reviews.Author: travelogista

Reviews.Content: conveniently located I have spent 5D4N in Hong Kong last June with friends and stay in Mayfair. The Hotel is located is very conveniently near to the Nathan MTR and surrounded with shops, restaurants, cafes and etc. The temple street night market is just within a short walking distance. We are satisfied with our rooms as it is not as small as what we have expected from the reviews that we read. My friends do complain that the air-con is very cold even after adjusting to a higher temperature in their room but the one in my room works fine. The carpet is not very clean and you can see the stain. However, the bed-sheets and blankets were white and stainless (very important).The bathroom is clean except the sliding door which not be locked. We did have problem with some throttling of the tap in the shower. There was a small television set in the corner, with few channels for selection. But at least we get information on what is going on in the town.The staffs are friendly and helpful. They were well versed in English and always serve with smile. Overall, the stay is a pleasant one. I may go back to this hotel when I visit Hong kong again.
Reviews.Author: philinn

Reviews.Content: Shoebox in a good location The Mayfair Garden is just a stone's throw from Nathan Road and a beehive of shops and restaurants. The room, however, is the size of the average home bathroom. The Bathroom is the size of the average home WC, lacking a closing door for privacy - a sliding one is the only protection from prying eyes.The room key (when given the right one) is tricky to work and relies not on an actual key mechanism, nor a swipe card, but a plastic tab with holes punched in it which requires jiggling to work. The television channels offered are awful by Asian standards.Considering the price of the room puts this is in the middle range of Hong Kong hotels, much more should be expected than is delivered. The YMCA in Wan Chai was more spacious (relative to Hong Kong rooms) and offered more features all at a lower price. And it had a bathroom door.The only redeeming quality is the proximity to Nathan road and the short distance required to get to places like Jordan MTR station and the harbour.
Reviews.Author: JoeCooper
